content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-245-11-B |Item_parent=Adrenal insufficiency in adults and children |Item_parent_short=Adrenal insufficiency in adults and children |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the pharmacological characteristics and bioequivalence of the main corticoids |Description=None |Rubric=Management |Contributors=Claire Briet,Stéphanie Espiard |Order=11}} Table 3: Pharmacological characteristics of the main glucocorticoids. {| class="wikitable" | |Hydrocortisone |Prednisone |Prednisolone |Dexamethasone |- |''Biological half-life''' |8 - 12 hours |18 - 36 hours |18 - 36 hours |36 - 54 hours |- |Bioequivalence |20 mg |5 mg |5 mg |0.75 mg |- |''Glucocorticoid activity'' |1 |4 |4 |40 |}

properties.question: Which glucocorticoid has the highest bioequivalence value?
properties.option_a: Hydrocortisone, with a bioequivalence of 20 mg
properties.option_b: Prednisone, with a bioequivalence of 5 mg
properties.option_c: Prednisolone, with a bioequivalence of 5 mg
properties.option_d: Dexamethasone, with a bioequivalence of 0.75 mg
